title: AWS Core Services to Azure Services: Technology Stack and Service Selection
certificationWeight: 34% - Cloud Technology and Services Domain (Largest Weight)
description: Master core cloud services by understanding AWS technology stack and migrating to Azure equivalents with service selection guidance, use case mapping, and hands-on service identification across compute, storage, database, and networking categories.
learningObjectives: Identify core AWS compute services and their Azure equivalents
Understand AWS storage services and migrate to Azure storage options
Learn AWS database services and compare with Azure database offerings
Explore AWS networking services and their Azure counterparts
Understand service selection criteria and use case mapping
Learn how to choose appropriate services for different scenarios
prerequisites: Completion of CLF-C02 Cloud Concepts Lab
Completion of CLF-C02 Security and Compliance Lab
Basic understanding of IT infrastructure components
Familiarity with servers, storage, and networking concepts
businessScenario: GlobalTech Solutions runs a multi-tier web application that includes web servers, application servers, databases, and file storage. They currently use traditional on-premises infrastructure but want to understand cloud services and create a migration plan. They need to identify the right cloud services for their compute, storage, database, and networking needs while comparing AWS and Azure options for the best fit.

sections.title: Compute Services and Virtual Infrastructure
topics: Amazon EC2 virtual machines and instance types
Azure Virtual Machines and VM sizes
AWS Lambda serverless functions
Azure Functions serverless computing
Container services: AWS ECS vs Azure Container Instances
Service selection criteria for different compute needs

tasks.title: Design Compute Architecture
tasks.description: Select appropriate compute services for different application requirements
steps: Analyze sample application requirements and compute needs
Explore Amazon EC2 instance types and their use cases
Compare with Azure Virtual Machine sizes and pricing tiers
Evaluate AWS Lambda for serverless use cases
Compare with Azure Functions for event-driven computing

sections.title: Storage Services and Data Management
topics: Amazon S3 object storage and storage classes
Azure Blob Storage and access tiers
Amazon EBS block storage for virtual machines

tasks.description: Design comprehensive storage solution for different data types and access patterns
steps: Categorize data types: files, databases, backups, archives
Map Amazon S3 storage classes to data lifecycle requirements
Compare with Azure Blob Storage access tiers and pricing
Design block storage strategy with Amazon EBS

sections.title: Database Services and Data Platforms

tasks.title: Database Architecture Design
tasks.description: Select appropriate database services for different application data requirements
steps: Analyze application data requirements and access patterns
Evaluate Amazon RDS options for relational data

sections.title: Networking and Content Delivery
topics: Amazon VPC networking and security groups

tasks.title: Network Architecture Planning
tasks.description: Design secure and scalable network infrastructure
steps: Design Amazon VPC with proper subnet segmentation

Implement security groups and network access controls

hands-onExercises.title: Service Selection Workshop
hands-onExercises.description: Complete service selection exercise for different business scenarios
steps: Review three different business scenarios: startup, enterprise, e-commerce
Identify compute, storage, database, and networking requirements
Select appropriate AWS services for each scenario
Map equivalent Azure services with justification
Calculate basic cost estimates for each solution
Present recommendations with pros and cons analysis
hands-onExercises.expectedOutcome: Comprehensive service selection recommendations for multiple scenarios

hands-onExercises.title: Architecture Migration Planning
hands-onExercises.description: Plan migration of existing on-premises architecture to cloud services
steps: Analyze provided on-premises architecture diagram
Identify current infrastructure components and dependencies
Map each component to appropriate AWS cloud services
Create equivalent Azure architecture design
Plan migration approach and sequence
Identify potential challenges and mitigation strategies
hands-onExercises.expectedOutcome: Complete migration plan with cloud service mapping and implementation strategy

hands-onExercises.title: Cost Optimization Challenge
hands-onExercises.description: Optimize cloud service selection for cost efficiency
steps: Review over-provisioned sample architecture
Identify cost optimization opportunities
Right-size compute and storage resources
Evaluate reserved capacity and savings plans
Compare AWS and Azure pricing for optimized design
Calculate potential cost savings and ROI
hands-onExercises.expectedOutcome: Cost-optimized architecture with measurable savings and efficiency improvements

troubleshooting.issue: Overwhelming number of service options and configurations
troubleshooting.solution: Start with core services, use decision trees for service selection, and provide clear use case examples for each service

troubleshooting.issue: Difficulty understanding when to use different storage types
troubleshooting.solution: Create storage decision matrix based on performance, access frequency, and cost requirements with practical examples

troubleshooting.issue: Confusion between similar services on AWS and Azure
troubleshooting.solution: Provide side-by-side comparison tables, highlight key differences, and explain unique capabilities of each platform
